name: Khan ‘Sadh’ Mostafa
highlights: Software Engineer at Teledata Communications, Inc.
MS in <abbr data-toggle='tooltip' title='Computer Science'>CS</abbr> from Stony Brook / B.Sc. in <abbr data-toggle='tooltip' title='Computer Science and Engineering'>CSE</abbr>  from KUET

experience.about: TCI builds and provides SaaS for financial institutions. It's flagship product is Decision Lender - a “Loan Origination Solution” for banks and credit unions.

description: Building new version of TCI’s Loan Origination SaaS-
Decision Lender 4x
- Design, code and implement business logic, data models and user interfaces based on
generic and client specific requirements for developing a RESTful SaaS, catering to various lenders.
This includes building core platform, vehicle valuation services, configurable report generation framework,
various 3rd party integration etc.
- Since initial release, continuously enhancing and adding features to on-board clients,
while also collaborate with various teams within the org to cultivate better understanding of the product.

info.description: Developed and maintained Decision Lender v3.5 for new and existing clients
Worked for CA Technologies at <abbr data-toggle='tooltip' title='Center of Excellence in Wireless and Information Technology'>CEWIT</abbr> as on campus internship during MS

experience.about: SRBD is one of the 33 global Research & Development centers and 6 Design centers of Samsung Electronics. It is considered as first R&D settlement of a multinational corporation in Bangladesh. Its operation started in June, 2010. At that time, Sadh joined the inaugural team of ten.

info.description: Designed a host – target interaction protocol and developed control module with GUI for <abbr data-toggle='tooltip' title='Field-programmable gate array'>FPGA</abbr> and post-silicon SoC (System on Chip) verification platform
Developed modules of a camera SoC verification tool based on μC/OS-II
As part of DSP project ported μC/OS-II for custom BSP, ported Web-P for Samsung’s Reconfigurable Processor, developed image codec
Developed localized feature phone system software for target markets
Developed smart phone apps for Samsung’s bada platform

education.about: The State University of New York at Stony Brook (also referred to as Stony Brook University, SUNY Stony Brook, SBU) is a public sea-grant and space-grant research university located in Stony Brook, New York in the United States. It is part of the State University of New York (SUNY) system.

info.description: Designed tool for opinion mining which leverages entity-keyword bi-graph built from analyzing social network feed
Implemented a procedural watercolor engine to recreate real-time watercolor effects
Added XML parser for BOSS (brain model simulation tool) INIT module to feed brain model parameters as XML input

education.about: KUET, a public university in Bangladesh, emphasizes on engineering and technology. It has a comprehensive Computer Science and Engineering program.

description: “RDF by Structured Reference to Semantics
– An approach to emerge Semantic Web”:
Developed a framework (RS2-fx) to convert current html web documents into
Semantic Web RDF documents
by extracting underlying semantics backed by support of an existing ontology
<a href='http://slidesha.re/RS2fx1'class='print-link'>

info.description: Developed an automated traffic jam recognition and alert tool, Traffic Window, aided with image processing

description: Developed a Smart home technology, which includes a centrally controlled local system of devices and sensors that actuates smartly upon perceptions. The control unit interfaces with local GUI as well as internet and cellular networks

sideNotes.head: Talked
sideNotes.body: on “Research in the Computing Industry” at CSE Festival, KUET (Jun 2012)

sideNotes.head: Awarded
sideNotes.body: “Icon of the Month” by Samsung R&D Institute – Bangladesh

sideNotes.head: 11th place
sideNotes.body: on ACM ICPC Dhaka Regional programming contest 2007

sideNotes.head: Showcased project
sideNotes.body: “Smart Home Technology” at BASIS SoftExpo, Dhaka 2008
